oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Movie premiere crowd outside Hermitage Hotel
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: People; Hotels
Storer, Walter Henry, 1898-; Hermitage Hotel (Nashville, Tenn.) -- History; Cooper, Prentice, 1895-1969; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 35mm slide showing large crowd in the street and on the sidewalks around the Hermitage Hotel. The Tennessee State Capitol is visible at right. Three closed sedans are parked at the curb. Several policemen are present. Most people are in shirtsleeves; some are wearing straw boaters.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Dr. Walter H. Storer Photograph Collection, ca. 1930-1955
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These photographs were taken by Dr. Walter Henry Storer, an amateur photographer who was a Vanderbilt University professor of romance languages. The Knickerbocker Theatre in Nashville opened March 22, 1916, and closed February 4, 1961. The Hotel Hermitage (named for Andrew Jacksons estate) opened on Saturday, September 17, 1910.
